result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric Deshauwn Birmingham was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Letter in response to Ms. Webb's request to lift no contact order.
Letter from L. Webb requesting removal of No Contact Order

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant sentenced to serve 5 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to count 2 and any other sentence, with credit for 1 (one) day time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 year.

AS TO COUNT 2:

Defendant sentenced to serve 5 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to count 1 and any other sentence, with credit for 0 (zero) days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 year.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS:

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
     *   As a condition of probation, the Court ordered
          the defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction.
          Huber release for work ONLY: Report date: August 3, 2015 by 5:00 p.m. 
     *   Continue Parenting Classes.
     *   Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
          treatment deemed appropriate.
     *   No contact with Lambriel W.
     *   Obtain and maintain employment or actively looking
          for employment.
     *   No dangerous weapons.
     *   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges during the period
          of probation. 
          Any remaining balance at the end of probation will be due  
          immediately or an entry of a civil judgment.

 Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights and Sentencing Referral Form; received and filed.

Defendant Eric Deshauwn Birmingham in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Defendant Eric Deshauwn Birmingham in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Eric Deshauwn Birmingham in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.   
Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.  Defense counsel requests additonal time to review discovery and offer.  Case is adjourned for status Conference in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Lambriel W

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

Defendant Eric Deshauwn Birmingham in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Defendant Eric Deshauwn Birmingham in custody.  Lovell Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Dee, Br. 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
